sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词的均含"设计，设想"之意。
means: devise ： 侧重设计的临时性和权宜性，并隐含有更多的设想可用。
conceive ： 强调在制定计划之前的先有设想构思。
formulate与conceive相反，指在devise之后的具体设计活动。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均可表示"在思想中形成一个看法或观念"之意。
means: think ： 最普通用词，指想或思索，也指由反复思考而作出判断或得出结论等。
conceive ： 指在头脑中组织好自己的思想，在心中形成一个系统的思想或一个见解。
imagine比conceive更强调形象思维，指在头脑中形成一个清晰明确的意象。
fancy与imagine略不同，往往指的是不切实际的，属于梦幻般的想象。
realize ： 指领悟，通过生动的构思或想象从而抓住事物的本质。

sentence.Network_en: Women, he says, should give up alcohol before they plan to conceive.
sentence.Network_cn: 他说女性在计划怀孕之前应该戒酒。

sentence.Network_en: You may conceive a new world in the atomic age.
sentence.Network_cn: 你可以设想出原子时代的新世界.

sentence.Network_en: I can hardly conceive of your doing such a thing.
sentence.Network_cn: 我很难想象你会做出这种事情.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French concevoir, from Latin concipere, from com- 'together' + capere 'take'

entry.def: If you cannot conceive of something, you cannot imagine it or believe it.

example.ex: I just can't even conceive of that quantity of money...
example.tran: 那么多钱，我根本都无法想象。

example.ex: He was immensely ambitious but unable to conceive of winning power for himself.
example.tran: 他雄心勃勃，但是想不出自己能如何赢得权力。

entry.def: If you conceive something as a particular thing, you consider it to be that thing.

example.ex: The ancients conceived the earth as afloat in water...
example.tran: 古人认为地球飘浮在水里。

example.ex: We conceive of the family as being in a constant state of change...
example.tran: 我们认为家庭处于不断变化之中。

entry.def: If you conceive a plan or idea, you think of it and work out how it can be done.

example.ex: She had conceived the idea of a series of novels...
example.tran: 她萌生出撰写系列小说的想法。

example.ex: He conceived of the first truly portable computer in 1968.
example.tran: 1968年，他构想出第一台真正的便携式计算机。

entry.def: When a woman conceives, she becomes pregnant.

example.ex: Women, he says, should give up alcohol before they plan to conceive...
example.tran: 他说女性在计划怀孕之前应该戒酒。

example.ex: About one in six couples has difficulty conceiving...
example.tran: 大约1/6的夫妻有受孕困难。

sentences.sentence: "He conceived of a robot that would help paralyzed patients"

means.word_mean: 2. judge or regard; look upon; judge;

sentences.sentence: "I believe her to be very smart"
"I think that he is her boyfriend"
"The racist conceives such people to be inferior"
"My daughter was conceived in Christmas Day"

stems_affixes.word_buile: conceive[v.想象;构想;怀孕]+able可以……的→adj.可想象的
receive[[v.接受;收到]]eive变体为cip+ent……的;人或物等→recipient接受的;接受者
con共同+ceit=ceive拿,抓,握住→[自以为]全部抓到→自大
receive[[v.接受;收到]]eive变体为cip+ent……的;人或物等→recipient接受的;接受者
con共同+ceive抓→大家一起抓[思想]→构想

Sentence.sentence: Most high governmental officials seem to conceive of education in this light—as a way to ensure economic competitiveness and continued economic growth," Derek Bok, former president of Harvard, told The Washington Post.

means.word_mean: 想出（主意、计划等）；, 构想, 设想

sentences.en: You may conceive a new world in the atomic age.
sentences.cn: 你可以设想出原子时代的新世界。

sentences.en: I conceived that there must be some difficulties.
sentences.cn: 我料想到一定有些困难。

jushi.english: She conceived the child last year.
